alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 09 at 2:12AM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Northern High Plains and Southern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Wednesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. Travel could be difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they have appropriate knowledge and gear and may want to consider alternate plans. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additions snow and wind chill statements will likely be need for Thursday and Friday.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.

area.areaDesc: Northern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
